name: NWN EE, RDD 7 and Retroactive HP gain no longer occurs?
author: Orion

posts.author: Orion
posts.content:
Hi everyone!
 
It looks like when one takes an RDD 7 level (and gains +2 CON), there is no longer retroactive HP gain that I think happened in the past. 
I spoke to Aquarius and he seemed to recall it happened in the past.
And certainly when I input the build in Kamiryn's CBC2842 (the latest version updated this year), it is suggested the retroactive HP gain would occur.

At RDD 7, the expected max HP gain is +29hp (+13 from +d10 plus +2modifier +1toughness, and +16 from retroactive HP gain from 16 hit die and +2 con).
HP would increase from 131 to 160hp.

I take my level in the Pretty Good Character Creator Module v43 from Sorc 8 / Paladin 1 / RDD 6 to Sorc 8 / Paladin 1 / RDD 7. I have max HP rolls before leveling.

The expected HP was 160 if you look at Kamiryn's spreadsheet, but the actual HP ends up 144, 16HP less than expected.

There were some changes Beamdog made to RDD and stat gain from RDD's Draconic Abilities feat in the last 6-12 months. 
I am curious if these changes affected this.

Can anyone else confirm that this is not expected or confirm they are seeing this as well?
I have also noticed it in WoG,  WoG uses a custom Dragon Disciple so players can have different breath types, so I made sure I also checked it in Vanilla NWN (above)
I am using NWN EE v80.8193.13 [3ba0f825]

posts.author: Yunim
posts.content: This has been the case since Beamdog softcoded the PM/RDD changes. For single player you will need to save and reload for PM/RDD changes to take effect after levelling, for multiplayer you need to relog.

posts.author: Aquarius 233
posts.content:
Sorry to bump into this thread, but finally it is the time I can learn which is the difference between softcoded and hardcoded.
It seems to me from your answer, Yunim, that the "free toughness" feat from RDD 7 is only not visible at the level up screen, but it will be available after relod or relog: hence softcoded should mean "not listed within the changes", but occurred nonetheless.

posts.author: Yunim
posts.content: In 1.69, the ability and AC increases from PM/RDD levels were hardcoded into the game and couldn't be changed directly (although there were ways around this such as using third party programs). In EE those increases are now softcoded and can easily be customised by editing 2da files. One of the main advantages of this other than further customisation is that it's now safe to delevel RDDs, but it does cause some issues such as needing to reload/relog when levelling.
